sentences.en: As we drew near, I saw that the boot lid was up.
sentences.cn: 我们靠近时,我看见汽车行李箱的盖子翘了起来.

sentences.en: Canberra's cabbies go in boots and all for a fair deal.
sentences.cn: 堪培拉的出租车司机一心只为做上一笔公道的生意。

sentences.en: Go over to your PC and boot it up.
Harris got a rope from the car boot.
sentences.cn: 哈里斯从汽车行李箱里拿出一条绳子。

sentences.en: He is making money and receiving free advertising to boot!
sentences.cn: 他既挣了钱，又做了免费的广告！

sentences.en: His girl gave him the boot.
I can boot up from a floppy disk, but that's all.
sentences.cn: 我可以用一张软盘来启动，但其他的就无能为力了。

sentences.en: I helped her stow her bags in the boot of the car.
sentences.cn: 我帮她将包放进汽车行李箱里。

sentences.en: Our real bete noire is the car boot sale.
sentences.cn: 我们最烦那些用汽车后备箱摆摊卖旧货的。

sentences.en: Put the luggage in the boot.
sentences.cn: 把行李放在汽车行李箱里.

sentences.en: The officer stamped his boot. "Don't be insolent with me, mademoiselle."
sentences.cn: 军官跺跺靴子：“小姐，别对我无礼。”

sentences.en: The outline of Italy suggests a boot.
sentences.cn: 意大利的轮廓像只长统靴.

sentences.en: They have to be thin, attractive and well-dressed to boot.
sentences.cn: 她们必须得既苗条又迷人，而且一定要打扮漂亮。

sentences.en: What he needs is a good boot up the backside!
sentences.cn: 他需要的是在他屁股上狠狠踢一脚.

sentences.en: you can bet your boots that the patrol has raised the alarm.
sentences.cn: 巡逻兵肯定已经发出警报了。

words.tran_cn: 无用的；无益的；无利可图的；没穿鞋的
踢（boot的过去式和过去分词）；使穿靴
非法制造；秘密得到（bootleg的ing形式）

phrases.tran_cn: n. ［美口］海军训练新兵之营地
启动菜单；引导菜单；开机选单
n. 引导扇区；启动磁区
(澳/新西兰，非正式)不受约束地；全心全意地
系统引导失败；磁盘自举失败

phrases.phrase: put the boot in (或 into someone)
phrases.tran_cn: (英，非正式)（在对方倒地后）狠狠踢上一脚

phrases.phrase: with one's heart in one's boots

trans.tran_en: a type of shoe that covers your whole foot and the lower part of your leg
to kick someone or something hard
